name: Trial by code
description:
Computer Science Society

A coding contest consisting of problem-solving questions, starting with easy and then progressively getting harder. It will be beneficial for practice for future OT's and Interviews and will build skills. We are planning on having a scoreboard based on the number of questions/test cases passed.

Team size: Solo - 1

name: Escape room: algorithmic approach
description:
Computer Science Society

Similar to a normal escape room except every level consists of an algorithm. Example: data structure: graphs, level 1 (Kahn's algo), level 2 (Dijkstra), level 3 (Kruskal's/Prim's).

Team size: Team of 3 members

name: Tech Wordle
description:
Computer Science Society

The event is a CS-themed word puzzle game where participants must guess technical terms related to computer science, such as algorithms, programming languages, or data structures.

Team size: Solo event

name: Data Science
description:
Computer Science Society

Solve business problems using data science. Use ML, AI concepts to solve the problem statement. Level-wise problem statements will be given.

Team size: Solo event

name: Mouse less Contest
description:
Computer Science Society

You will be given tasks and you have to do it without using a mouse. This can be done in a booth where there will be volunteers who will check whether the mouse is being used or not.

Team size: Solo event

name: Build-A-PC Challenge
description:
ECE Society

An engaging team event where students will have the opportunity to assemble their own fully functional PCs. Teams will race against the clock to assemble their PCs.

Team size: Team of 3 members

name: Debugger’s Duel
description:
ECE Society

A group-based challenge where participants troubleshoot and fix intentional faults in pre-designed circuits. External resources are prohibited.

Team size: Team of up to 4 members

name: LLD: Game on!
description:
ECE Society

A coding challenge where participants are given incomplete classes and objects and must implement the correct methods to develop a game.

Team size: Solo event

name: Voltage Vortex
description:
EEE Society

Series of rounds where questions and tasks related to electrical engineering are given.

Team size: Team of 6 members

name: Dare to feel the pain
description:
EEE Society

This event brings you the chance of experiencing the pain of period cramps through a simulator.

Team size: Solo event

name: Simulation and Modelling workshop
description:
EEE Society

Participants will explore real-world scenarios, using MATLAB/Simulink software to model circuits, power systems, and control systems.

Team size: Solo event

name: Mechanical Kit Assembly
description:
Mechanical Engineering Society

A mechanical kit will be provided for the team to assemble using different assembly drawings and component lists.

Team size: Team of 3 members

name: Primavera Workshop
description:
Civil Engineering Society

Primavera is a construction management software. A workshop in the software training with a case study will be given to the participants.

Team size: Team event

name: Concrete Canoe Contest
description:
Civil Engineering Society

Concrete canoe contest is concrete boat making which has to float in water.

Team size: Team event

name: Forensic Investigation
description:
Biotechnology Society

A workshop on DNA fingerprinting and other forensic technologies involved in criminal investigation.

Team size: Team of 3 members

name: Cellution
description:
Biotechnology Society

Round 1: a quiz about the topics involved in the problem statement. Round 2: The team must propose a viable solution for a developmental challenge in biotechnology.

Team size: Team of 3 members

name: Metallusion(Display)
description:
MME Society

A display of illusionary materials where participants can explore and interact with various unique materials.

Team size: Team of 2 to 4 members

name: Meta Forge
description:
MME Society

A quiz event where questions are based on guessing or a fun topic chosen by the participants.

Team size: Team of 2 members

name: Metarush
description:
MME Society

Participants solve clues related to metallurgy and materials. They will collect clues from each department.

Team size: Team of 4 members

name: Mysteries of Materials(demo)
description:
MME Society

Discover hidden mysteries behind iconic failures and achievements through interactive displays.

Team size: Team event

name: Mystery Maze
description:
MME Society

A classroom will be required and it will be completely dark, then participants will be given clues to find the materials among all materials which are hidden.

Team size: Team of 2 members

name: Inno Chem
description:
chES

The event offers a platform for inquisitive minds to present insights on Sustainable Energy and Environment: Role of Chemical Engineering, captivating the audience with flair and passion.

Team size: Not specified

name: Chem Quest Auction
description:
chES

Teams bid on industrial chemical compounds to create meaningful reactions. The team with the most valid reactions wins.

Team size: Not specified

name: Chem Relay Race
description:
chES

Teams compete in a relay race where each member must complete chemical-related challenges at various checkpoints across campus.

Team size: Not specified

name: MATLAB Workshop
description:
chES

Participants will gain hands-on experience with MATLAB for applications in chemical engineering, including data analysis and simulation.

Team size: Not specified

name: Chem E Case
description:
chES

Participants will analyze a problem statement in chemical engineering and present original solutions.

Team size: Not specified

name: Find X
description:
Mathematics Society

A multi-level mathematics-based competition where the competitors have to solve the mathematical challenges and gain that X points which will help them to win the competition.

Team size: Not specified

name: Treco Hunt
description:
Mathematics Society

Treasure hunt integrated with mathematics. Teams must solve mathematical puzzles and challenges to find clues.

Team size: Not specified

name: Centre of Mass Game
description:
Physics Society

Balance an object at their centre of mass using minimal support.

Team size: Team of 3 to 4 members.

name: Science Quiz Relay
description:
Physics Society

A quiz-based relay race where teams have to solve science problems quickly.

Team size: Team of 3 to 4 members.

name: Optics Laser Target Game
description:
Physics Society

Participants use mirrors and lenses to direct a laser beam at specific targets from a distance.

Team size: Team of 3 to 4 members.

name: Physics Model Demonstration
description:
Physics Society

Models which are based on the physical phenomenon.

Team size: Team of 3 to 4 members.

name: Product Launch
description:
Management Society

The event aims at understanding the creativity of the team while launching a product.

Team size: Team of 3 members.

name: Future Manager
description:
Management Society

An individual will be tested on leadership and other skills related to management.

Team size: Solo event.

name: Let him Cook
description:
Chemistry Society

There will be 3-5 boxes, 2 containing organic and metal compounds named chits. One containing solvents, one containing reagents and catalyst named chits.

Team size: Individual event.

name: Chemistry Reaction Exhibit
description:
Chemistry Society

Letting the participants perform simple reactions using day to day products and letting them know the chemistry behind it.

Team size: Individual event.

name: Periodic Table Battleship
description:
Chemistry Society

3 stages of activities will be there based on purely periodic table (Participants must be aware of each and everything related to periodic table).

Team size: Individual event.

name: Chemophile-Racing
description:
Chemistry Society

It’s a toy car racing but the fuel for this car is not a battery or a fuel. This car will go on the principle of some reaction which can move that car. Anyone (individual) can design the reaction and present that car for the race.

Team size: Individual event.
